Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: Two persons are holding a rope of negligible mass horizontally. A 20 kg mass is attached to the rope at the midpoint; as a result the rope deviates from the horizontal direction. The tension required to completely straighten the rope is (g = 10 m /s2)
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Let T be the tension in the rope: 2Tcosθ = mg. Where θ = 90°, T = mg/ 2cos90, cos90 = 0. So = mg/0 = ∞, T = ∞ Hence tension will be infinite.

Physics (Energy Conversion).subject: Physics (Energy Conversion)
Physics (Energy Conversion).question: Which one of the following does not convert electrical energy into light energy?
Physics (Energy Conversion).explanation: The heat from the wick melts the wax which gets absorbed in the wick and then gets burnt (which is really oxidation) to produce heat energy as well as light energy.

Physics (Electromagnetism).subject: Physics (Electromagnetism)
Physics (Electromagnetism).question: The visible portion of the electromagnetic spectrum is
Physics (Electromagnetism).explanation: The visible spectrum is the portion of the electromagnetic spectrum that is visible to the human eye. Electromagnetic radiation in this range of wavelengths is called visible light or simply light. A typical human eye will respond to wavelengths from about 380 to 740 nanometers.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: When a convex lens produces a real image of an object, the minimum distance between the object and image is equal to
options: the focal length of the convex lens
twice the focal length of the convex lens
four times the focal length of the convex lens
one half of the focal length of the convex lens
Physics (Optics).answer: four times the focal length of the convex lens
Physics (Optics).explanation: Let the distance between the object and its real image formed by a convex lens be d. Let the distance of the object from the lens be x, So the image distance from the lens is (d – x). For real value of x, d^2 >= 4fd, so d >= 4f. Therefore the minimum distance the objects and its real image formed by convex lens is 4f.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: The direction of magnetic field at any location on the earth’s surface is commonly specified in terms of
options: both field declination and field inclination
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).answer: both field declination and field inclination
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: The direction of the magnetic field at any location on Earth’s surface is commonly specified in terms of two angles. The angle of the magnetic north relative to the true north is called the Declination or the Variation. When we are facing the Magnetic North, the angle that field makes with the Horizontal is called the Inclination or Magnetic dip.

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: In which of the following, heat loss is primarily not due to convection?
options: Circulation of air around blast furnace
Heating of glass surface of a bulb due to current in filament
Physics (Thermodynamics).answer: Heating of glass surface of a bulb due to current in filament
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: Convection is transfer of heat through a medium and in bulb transfer due to radiation.
